p: For instance, Tian et al. (2011) showed considerable anti-influenza A effects of aqueous extracts of five traditionally employed herbal medicine ( Duchesnea indica, Fragaria indica, Liquidambar formosana, Lithospermum erythrorhizon, Melia toosendan and P. vulgaris). The study conducted by the Tian et al. (2011) revealed that these the extracts from these plants including P. vulgaris can act strongly against influenza virus through anti-neuraminidase activity.
